result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:37 p.m.
Attorney Shawn Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Chad L Conrath.  
Defendant Chad L Conrath appeared by video in custody at Prairie Du Chien Correctional.
Court conducts colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.
Court accepts the defendant's waiver of prelim.
Preliminary Hearing Waived, matter is bound over.
Information filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waived reading, and enters Not Guilty plea.
State makes a motion to dismiss and read-in this case to 22CF746.
Court grants.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards and mail.

02:58 PM Defendant Chad L Conrath in court by zoom video, in custody Prairie du Chien Correctional, with attorney Cassandra A Miller by zoom video.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Atty. Miller requests a waiver of preliminary hearing at the time of plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
